<title level="1" right="Focus 5" pfs="Standard">[Arcane Countermeasure](/Spells.aspx?ID=496)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Sorcerer" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=148" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 403 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Bloodline**
[Imperial](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=9)

<row gap="medium">

<row gap="tiny">
<row>**Cast**</row>
<row><actions string="Reaction" /></row>
<row>[somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283)</row>
</row>

**Trigger** A creature within range that you can see Casts a Spell.

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 120 feet

**Target** the spell cast by the triggering creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You undermine the target spell, making it easier to defend against. You reduce the spell's level by 1, and targets of the spell gain a +2 status bonus to any saving throws, skill checks, AC, or DC against it.

 You can't reduce the spell's level below its minimum. For example, a 5th-level [_cone of cold_](/Spells.aspx?ID=47) would remain 5th-level, but a 5th-level [_fireball_](/Spells.aspx?ID=119) would become 4th-level. Targets still gain all the other benefits, even if you don't reduce the spell's level.
name: Arcane Countermeasure
